user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_socket_noninheritable_:
```c
int
MHD_socket_noninheritable_ (MHD_socket sock)
{
#if defined(MHD_POSIX_SOCKETS)
  int flags;

  flags = fcntl (sock,
                 F_GETFD);
  if (-1 == flags)
    return 0;

  if ( ((flags | FD_CLOEXEC) != flags) &&
       (0 != fcntl (sock,
                    F_SETFD,
                    flags | FD_CLOEXEC)) )
    return 0;
#elif defined(MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS)
  if (! SetHandleInformation ((HANDLE) sock,
                              HANDLE_FLAG_INHERIT,
                              0))
    return 0;
#endif /* MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS */
  return ! 0;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I reviewed the entire function and found no use of compiler language extensions that are commonly documented as extensions (for example: __attribute__, __declspec, typeof, statement-expressions ({ ... }), inline assembly, nested functions, GCC or MSVC builtins, or other vendor-specific keywords). Specific notes: - The conditional compilation (#if defined(...)) and use of platform APIs (fcntl, FD_CLOEXEC for POSIX; SetHandleInformation and HANDLE for WinAPI) are standard preprocessor and platform-API usage, not compiler language extensions. - The cast (HANDLE) sock is a normal C cast; HANDLE is a platform typedef, not a language extension. - The use of the logical-not operator in return ! 0 is standard C and not an extension. - The function declaration and control flow are standard C constructs. Therefore there are no code fragments requiring investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 in the provided code.
